Reviews.Title: “Fair Value - Good Service”
Reviews.Author: bmodman
Reviews.Content: Location and service are the best qualities of Windrose. walking to termini station for train and tour buses was convenient and service was very good. Breakfast is crowded at times as it is served in a rather small room. Rooms are also small (common for Rome) and a "double bed" was two singles pushed together. Bath was very good with more water power than any hotel I know...and I like that!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Natalie26Malta
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights. The hotel is small, good and has a very good location just a short walk away from the bus terminus. The staff especially the reception staff are very helpful and spoke good English. The hotel is very clean and rooms are a bit small however it was enough for what we needed in Rome since we spent all our days and nights out exploring so it met our needs. Breakfast had very limited choice however there is a small bar-cafe' right next door and we ended up having our breakfasts there in fact. If one wants luxury, I would not recommend this hotel obviously, however if you want a cheaper yet good hotel and good location it will meet your needs.

Reviews.Title: “nice little hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: vdeevy
Reviews.Content: check in was good mainly due to lovely guy on reception, very friendly and helpful with maps and details of different trips etc.... Room small but very clean, had requested roomon 5th floor with a balcony but they were being renovated. Bathroom small but fine, decent water pressure in shower , towels strange , bit like oversized tea towels but they did the job.Some reviews complained about breakfast but i thought it fine, continental but plenty to eat and lovely staff, Location very handy for buses , train etc.. and plenty places.. accessible by foot. Had lovely meal in Italian restaurant opposite hotel, jammed on a Sunday night which was good sign , but when we got back to hotel to have a nightcap on the terrace the "bar" was closed !!!! 10.15 pm!!!! not good and not happy!!! Lovely lady receptionist on our last night recommended a club called Fonclea and arranged taxi .... such a good night , great food and great band, and great staff. overall Windrose is fine for a few nights, comfortable, clean but don't expext a drink at the bar!!!!.

Reviews.Title: “Great 3 star hotel, clean and good location”
Reviews.Author: dansa3151
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in February. It's a great hotel. Friendly staff, a lovely breakfast room and overall a good standard clean hotel. The rooms are a nice size. The hotel is within walking distance of all the main sites of Rome and there are some lovely little restaurants nearby. I would have no worry in reccommending Windrose to anyone and I will be happy to go back for my next visit to Rome. What an amazing city ! Great trip and this was the right choice of hotel :)

Reviews.Title: “Great for family with teens”
Reviews.Author: B B
Reviews.Content: My husband and our 2 teenagers stayed at the Windrose mid June 2011 for 3 or 4 nights. The price, convenience (walking distance to Termini) and quiet location were perfect for us. The staff was so helpful and accommodating if your flight is delayed by several hours as our was. The quad room was basic but a/c and hot showers after a long day of walking was wonderful. If you are looking for luxury, this is not for you but if you want an affordable, decent place for your family, you can' beat this. We would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel good location”
Reviews.Author: TOKYONIGHTS
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Windrose hotel for 3 nights, the atmosphere was friendly. The staff at the reception and at the breakfast was very helpful. The location of the hotel is convienient, its 2-3mins away from stazione Termini (Metro and train station) but at night its better to use the metro station Republica because it feels safer. You can also walk to the main tourist attractions. The breakfast buffet is rather small but you can order any kind of coffee you want. The room was nice and fitted our needs, and there was always hot water at the shower. The street in front of the hotel was quite but inside the room you could hear noises for the corridor.

Reviews.Title: “Small But Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: JayBee25754
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located, this botique hotel provided us with a room that was clean with just enough room for two. We wouldn't have wanted any more luggage! Bathroom was tiny but functional. The hotel is close to the central station and pently of eateries. Our room was on the third floor. We rejected a first floor room that was next to a meeting / dining area and was very noisy. Staff were pleasant, helpful and efficient. Breakfast met expectations. We'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, welcoming staff,”
Reviews.Author: laura b
Reviews.Content: Hotel Windrose is in a great location to reach all the main sites of Rome on foot and it is a stones throw from the Termini (bus station & Train Station). The staff are very friendly and helpful. The rooms are basic and clean. All you need is somewhere to rest your head and get washed up as you will be out exploring the whole time you are there. The breakfast is continental and there is plenty to go round. The room is small but you do not have to wait to long for a table - 5mins max. When I return to Rome I will be staying at this hotal again, as a lone traveller they have single rooms which are spot on for me :) I will recommend this Hotel to anyone who wants to go to Rome and be in the centre of everything.

Reviews.Title: “Surly Receptionist unwelcoming to solo woman”
Reviews.Author: 23lora23l
Reviews.Content: I arrived at this hotel after walking from the Termini Train station on a very hot day and had to wait 10 minutes before the receptionist acknowledged my presence. She was engaged in a lengthy explanation of a map with 2 guests. I was given a room and the key card did not work. My room was on the 3rd floor and I had to get my luggage back to the desk but was told that I was not using it correctly and reluctantly gave me another card which thankfully worked. Later that evening I needed to do an online check-in for my flight the next day. It was a good thing that I had my own computer because she claimed that she was too busy. While I sat in the foyer a heated argument occured with the night receptionist who had arrived. Two women were waiting for towels and toilet paper. They were yelled at and thrown the toilet paper and had to wait 15 mins for their towels. I was becoming increasingly anxious about this hotel and did not enjoy my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: SuttoncoldfieldJays
Reviews.Content: Good location. We enjoyed comfortable stay although room was a little on the small side and breakfast room a little cramped. Breakfast could have been better although we enjoyed what we had. Special thanks to female receptionist who was extremely helpful and very informative. Very clean, pleasant lounge and all in all a good 3 days.

Reviews.Title: “Five minute walk from Termini Train, and Metro station.”
Reviews.Author: Jorge R
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is 5 minute walk from Termini train station from where you can reach everywere in italy. It has a train conection to Fiumicino Airport . The staff was helpful.The room was a little small, but It had all we need. You now have to pay in every hotel in Rome the tourist tax. 2 euro per night per guest..You have to pay in cash. It started in August 2011.

Reviews.Title: “Tricky special booking offer and no refund so far”
Reviews.Author: smile_w99
Reviews.Content: We've been to this hotel during x'mas and booked this hotel through HRS. Then we discovered later that there would be early bird offer thr' booking with hotel's website. Then we made the booking thr' hotel's website and cancelled our booking in HRS. However, in the morning of our 2nd day's stay, the receptionist told us that we had not cancelled the booking in HRS, though I've explained to him that my booking has been cancelled though it's been complicated by my changing of schedule few times which made the booking a bit complicated (I've booked 2 nights directly thr' hotel's website & 1 night thr' HRS due to full house). As I was in a hurry to go visiting, I agreed that they used the original price to charge me as he explained to me that extra agency fee had to be paid to the booking agent if I book thr' their website and so the hotel couldn't provide me that special offer, or otherwise I need to pay for both sides for same night! After I came back HK, I sent email to clarify with HRS and they said they would investigate. About half month later, they came back to us that the hotel has made some mistakes and then they asked us to directly deal with the hotel. Lastly, the hotel agreed to re-pay us the over-charged amount. I have chased a few times thr' emails and they said the cheque would be sent out to me. However, up till now (it's more than half year), I still don't get their cheque! So please be careful when you book this hotel. I think they're not honest! Other than this unpleasant experience, we found the hotel value for money in this expensive city.

Reviews.Title: “An average 3* hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: LyttonLondon
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for a three night stay in Rome as part of a British Airways package. The position, close to Termini station is excellent - only a four minute walk, and with so many small family restaurants and other facilities very close by, it is difficult to fault the location. The reception staff were very friendly and helpful on arrival and offered maps and other useful information on things to do in Rome. Our twin room was okay - nothing more or less than that. There was a tv and a fridge, with a few soft drinks to purchase if required, a double built in wardrobe with a room safe (safe didn't work), an additional put-u-up bed, a chair and two bedside cabinets. The wall coverings were a little scuffed and the carpet was stained and looked old and tired. The beds were comfortable. Although the bathroom was tiny, it was extremely clean and provided with soap and shower liquid. The towels were replaced every day and were very clean, if not particularly thick. Our room was on the 2nd floor at the front of the hotel, so it was noisy. One oddity was that you couldn't walk up the stairs to your room but had to use the lift, which took ages to arrive. The staircase was only useable to walk downstairs as there was a self-closing mechanism on it! The breakfast room is tiny, but pretty. The breakfast is the usual continental fare, but not of a very high quality and not much to choose from, though you wouldn't go hungry. The lounge area is very attractive and there is a lovely roof terrace, but no bar up there. I guess you would have to take up a drink from the little bar in reception. There is a 24 hour coffee/tea etc machine, which was very reasonable. Lots of small family restaurants in the area but we would particularly recommend the one immediately opposite the Windrose Hotel, called La Famiglia. It is always very busy, but the food, service, prices and general atmosphere are great. There are often people queuing for a table but don't be deterred as these moved quickly, although once seated you are not rushed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gemm67
Reviews.Content: Clean, up to date, befitting ! Small but cozy. Hotel persons was kind and friendly. We reached too early for check-in but they have protected locker room to shop the luggages while going for the sight-seeing. Train position is in a short walk distance. Many shop in front of the hotel was cute location with pleasant Italian melodies and large pizza.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel but disappointed”
Reviews.Author: briangozo
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was good, rooms, breakfast and tidy but I had booked the room with a baby cot and this was not provided, when I told the reception they told me that infants have to be shared in our bed !!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, conveniently close to bus and train stations & restaurants.”
Reviews.Author: morroxena
Reviews.Content: Front Desk staff very helpful with guidance on local tours, shopping and beaches, and rooms were clean and comfortable. Breakfast was good and hotel had nice living room behind the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: friendlytipsMumbai
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a convenient location- close to the station. That's all I can recommend. Rooms are small and the bathroom is tiny- a tall person will barely fit into the shower stall. The breakfast is very basic. We stayed at other hotels in the same category across Italy and nowhere was the breakfast so basic.

Reviews.Title: “It's not a 3 star minus hotel”
Reviews.Author: gcimon
Reviews.Content: Positives: Location was good for us. We caugh the overcrowded subway to go everywhere and even walked from the spanish steps back to our room and it took about 30 minutes... Personnel was helpful and riendly Lobby was clean and attractive Negatives: Our room was filthy, carpets were stained and we had to wear our shoes when we go out of bed. The room was tiny, barely enough room move arounf the bed and to put our luggage. I am not a big person and the shower was so small I had trouble moving inside the shower while washing. The breakfast was very minimal.. a few breads, coldcuts, cheezes and some canned fruit. Also the room was also packed every morning and we had to wait in line to get in. All in all, this hotel barely makes it as a 3 star hotel and our expectations were for a 3 star hotel and we were dissapointed. I would NEVER go back to that hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would go back there in a heartbeat”
Reviews.Author: iltempovola
Reviews.Content: I'm a high school Italian teacher and in April of this year (2010), my colleague and I had the pleasure of staying at the Windrose with our group. We spent 3 days in Rome (this was the last part of our trip) and were very satisfied with the rooms & staff. Prior to arriving in Rome, we had stayed at hotels in Milano, Mestre (outside of Venezia) & Firenze. The Windrose was by far my favorite. The rates were excellent, it was clean, cozy and in a great location. Restaurants were literally around the corner. It was also close to Termini Subway Station which made getting around extremely convenient. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Poor hotel, annoying staff, dirty rooms, crap location, don't waste your money”
Reviews.Author: Ayds85
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Windrose Hotel in March as the first stop of our honeymoon! Upon arrival we were greeted by the reception lady who was obviously oblivious to the fact that we had just travelled for 25 hours on a flight from Australia and we where about to drop dead, instead of giving us our key she proceeded to try and sell us tours for our five day stay in Rome. When we arrived at our room we where greeted by two single beds, even though we specifically mentioned and paid for a Queen room, we where on our honeymoon for god's sake! When we told the lady downstairs she said that we would just have to wait until the next day. The next day came and we went and asked for a room swap and we where met with a rude man saying that we should have said something when we arrived. The Location of this hotel, contrary to what others have said is very poor. Yes you are close to the Termini which is great of you are catching a train and are only staying here for 1 or 2 nights, but you are a fair walk from Romes most stunning atrractions, such as the Vatican City, Piazza Navonna, the Spanish Steps, The Coleseum etc. Although if you are an Angels and Demons Fan, Santa Maria Della Vittoria church is less then 400 metres away. The one positive point and i say the only one is the breakfast. It is basic but very nice. All in all, this hotel really was the worst part of our trip and we look forward to never going back there.

Reviews.Title: “Watch Out: Thieves in the Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: RayIndonesia
Reviews.Content: My belongings are gone when we had breakfast inside the hotel. The more terrible things is that the hotel officer does not helping, they don't want to show CCTV, not helping to search, even not say sorry or offering drink to soothe my wife in panic. They keep defensively saying "I don't know, I don't know, it's your fault... etc" with high tone like they are the one who upset. And, they don't follow regulation to register people who come for breakfast (so they claimed that EVERYBODY can be there). I have stayed in so many hotels in so many countries, and every time we have to register when having breakfast so only hotel guest can be there.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for price, beautiful common area/lobby w free internet”
Reviews.Author: MongolGlobal
Reviews.Content: This property included all the essentials of a three star property. It was well located so easy walking distance to all sights. The staff was very friendly and there were some good value restaurants nearby. The lobby was very nice, especially for a three star. Rooms are fairly basic but have a classic style to them. I was very pleased with my experience there. The only thing I would say is that the coffee at breakfast was a little weak but you can just get espresso or go to a coffee bar which is always more fun anywho :)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location - we would stay again”
Reviews.Author: CJNetts
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location to the train station and all the sights of Rome, the metro stop is very close by so its easy to get around the city. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful and even let us use the lounge area while we waited for a late train, which was perfect as they have free Wi-fi. The rooms were adequate and comfortable, bathrooms were spacious and very clean. Our rooms had a huge terrace balcony. The restaurant across the road is wonderful, great food we went back twice. I would recommend staying here to anyone and would stay again if we were back in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money easy walking distance to central rome and termini”
Reviews.Author: lindyIreland
Reviews.Content: Stayed in windrose hotel for 4 nites with my partner and 3 year old daughter. All the staff were very friendly and helpful during our stay. Reception staff have very good english. The rooms were adequate for our needs and the hotel is 5 mins walk from the termini station, approx 15 mins walk central rome. The area has everything you would need Shops , restaurants etc. and I would recommend the restaurant across the road for a nice meal. There is only a mini bar service available in this hotel. My only complaint was our timing was'nt good as there were some building work taking place at another property at the back of the hotel so we were awake around 6.30a.m. each morning but who would want to stay in bed anyway when theres so much to see! Family from Ireland!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, good location”
Reviews.Author: nelson7007
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here for four nights in June and found it to be clean and good value. We booked a family room and found it to be well appointed and bigger than we expected and a welcome relief after the overnight train from Paris. Located just a few minutes easy walk from Termini, the area is relatively safe though can be a a little seedy at night. Nice bistro across the road and a great stop for espresso and a cake round the corner plus other services nearby. While the front desk staff were unfailingly polite and helpful, the same could not be said for the lady who served breakfast. She was rude and very unfriendly to the point of being a running joke in our family. The breakfast itself also matched the service - unappealing. But apart from that, it met our expectations and our budget.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel with good value for money 100% recommended”
Reviews.Author: CIVGreece
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, a great value for money. We had a very nice room with a large bathroom. The hotel is very posh for the price you have to pay and the services are also very good. The reception was helpfull and also suggested lots of things to see in rome. It was very clean and situated 250 meters from the central station so you do not have to carry luggage far. I highly recommend this, as I am a frequent traveller and have been to many many hotels. Yes, many do complain that the breakfast is not so splendid, which is not completely true as it was ok. Do not expect a Hilton breakfast but for this price is was superb. Enjoy a light breakfast and go to enjoy rome. 100% recommended

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Romyn-Michaud
Reviews.Content: Pros - excellent location (not even a 5 min walk from the Termini), clean room, excellent service, free Wi-Fi internet access, very close to many trattorias and ristorantes Cons - room is very small, washroom is small and shower is even smaller (a large person could not bathe here)

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, Convenient and Close to everything”
Reviews.Author: Bamse64
Reviews.Content: We stayed twice in May because we needed to be close to the station for travel to Venice and back to connect with a cruise. It was only an easy 10 minute walk even for 2 aged travellers with 3 suitcases! Our rooms were a bit small but quite adequate, and they were very quiet. There is a lift. The reception and waiting areas are large, modern and comfortable with the plus of a powder room, baggage storage, and a cappuchino machine- lovely at 10pm.There is a pleasant ground floor breakfast room with the usual,slightly better than average continental breakfast. They will do boiled eggs if you ask. Reception staff -English speaking- were very helpful with tour information [we recommend Ostia Antica] and also were quick to help after I was robbed on the notorious #64 bus to Termini. It was the first time in 30 years of travel, as I stupidly neglected to wear my moneybelt. The hotel is smart even though the area is a bit scruffy. There are several eateries, a handy little oriental coffee shop across the road serving perfect cappuchinos[ rare] and a fruit, vege and clothing market around the corner, though I'm not sure if it's every day.The Termini, of course, has plenty of cafes and shops.We would certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: LoveToTravel032
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Windrose Hotel for five nights at the end of April 2008. We have mixed feelings about it. Yes, it is within close proximity to Termini (about 5-8 minute walk) and in a relatively quiet street. There are lots of facilities close by including internet cafes, a laundry just two streets away, a supermarket 100 metres down the street and plenty of restaurants within a 5-10 minute walk. The problem for us was inside the hotel. Despite requesting a double bed at booking, we got twin beds which for some unknown reason couldn't be changed until the next day (despite the fact that cleaning staff were on our floor when we checked in). There was also a strange smell in the bathroom which lingered our whole stay. You could live with this, but it was the breakfast that got us. If you are on holidays and you want a 'feel good' start to your day, then don't eat breakfast here. It was very disappointing (the worst of our three weeks in Italy) - basic food, coffee undrinkable, breakfast staff unfriendly, and if you arrive towards the end of the service, don't expect much of anything. In fact one day we didn't even go down to breakfast, preferring to have brunch out. For Rome the room price was fairly cheap, but then you get what you pay for. Would not stay here again. We found ourselves walking past the Spanish Steps quite a lot, so would stay in this area next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value in Very Expensive City”
Reviews.Author: nottshammer
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel before, when we went on a football trip. It is in a very convenient location, close to the rail station and the tram terminus. It is also easy walking distance (if you are of a reasonable standard of fitness) for all of Rome's gems. The rooms are clean and modern but are of a fairly modest size but are perfectly fine, so long as you are not on the large side! The location is in a very quiet area, without the traffic noise of some parts of Rome. A definite bonus. The breakfast is nothing special but does the job. Overall we really enjoyed our stay in the city and also the time in the hotel. It really is in a brilliant location and also is very reasonably priced for Rome. Other 'budget' priced hotels have been nothing short of extortionate and so The Windrose is excellent value. The family Trattoria just across the road is excellent for traditional Italian food at good prices but I would highly recommend the North African restaurant just a bit further down the road (turn right out of the hotel, cross the road and 5 minutes walk away).

Reviews.Title: “NIce hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: WilmaCarlow
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Windrose Hotel during a city break at Easter. The hotel is situated in a quiet street, just 5 minutes from Termini train station / metro station / shopping centre. The hotel is clean, with spacious rooms and extremely friendly and helpful staff. There is a nice trattoria just opposite where you can enjoy a pizza at a reasonable price - or take one back to the hotel! The only thing that we felt needed improvement was the breakfast - very watery tasting OJ, no fruit or yogurts - and make sure to ASK the waitress for croissants (Really fresh and delicious). We chose the hotel mainly for its location. Despite the bad press that the Termini area sometimes gets we had no problems at all and would not hesitate in reommending the hotel. Be sure and get the open bus tour of the city (departs from Termini) - a great way of getting an overview of the city. Avoid the queues at the Colosseum by getting one of the guides outside - only cost a couple of euro extra and well worth it! The metro is also a great way to get around the Eternal City.

Reviews.Title: “fair value”
Reviews.Author: valics
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel mainly because of the convenient location(very close to Termini) and amenities offered. Nothing spectacular but it had well maintained nice rooms, in quiet location. The breakfast should really improve, the coffee was ok. Ok for the budget once, but would not stay there again as I guess there are thousands of similar hotels in Rome. Reception staff polite and efficient, with good english.

Reviews.Title: “Overall no complaints, clean, comfortable and convenient.”
Reviews.Author: stingytownman
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Windrose for two nights 21st Aug and 28th bracketing our 6 day stay in Sorrento, we did this to take advantage of a Ryanair flight and to catch up on the villa Borghese, which is well worth a visit incidentally. 21st was OK, we got our old room 116 (we stayed before last year) I had booked a quad, A dbl and twin single, but got 4 singles. We let it ride as it was one night, but my bed had a broken leg. We dropped the leg into reception on our way out, and it was fixed when we got back. Room was fine, air con lovely, bathroom as before (no bath, only shower cubicle which we prefer) Other than the breakfast which we didn’t like any more than last time the stay was fine. Tip: We used Trenitalia english website back in UK to book ICplus connection tickets Rome Termini to Naples both ways. This worked really well as we had ‘learned’ Termini area from last year. 28th we got room 406 quad, smaller and again 4 singles, Bath with shower attachment this time, but the shower head was set at waist height OK for small children or midgets (No offence to little people) but a pain for grown ups, like before didn’t complain as it only one night and it was three star. Overall no complaints, clean, comfortable and convenient but if we book again would stipulate room 116. Now for a really nice Hotel don’t forget to read my Tripadvisor review of Hotel Il Nido Sorrento.

Reviews.Title: “Windrose good value”
Reviews.Author: centralNFLD1
Reviews.Content: I chose the Windrose mainly because it offered the amenities I wanted (AC, breakfast included) in a reasonably convenient location. And it met my most important requirement: a budget traveller could afford it! It satisfied most of my requirements, & I wouldn't discourage anyone from staying there. It was clean, not particularly cramped (for what I've seen of Italian budget hotels), with a comfortable bed, a nice bathroom, and great AC (could control it yourself & it didn't turn off at night). Breakfast was fine (juice, bread, cheese, croissants, good coffee). I know some people think the area around Termini is threatening, but I was there as a solo woman, & I wasn't nervous. In the day time it's full of working people, tourists heading to 110 bus tours, or Italian travellers. I found it very convenient, as I could jump on the metro & start my day's sightseeing easily. There were restaurants, banks, internet cafes, etc., and of course an entire shopping mall in Termini. I arrived a bit early (around noon) & could check in right away, & there was luggage storage & a powder room available for the day I left (I didn't leave Rome until 6 p.m.) My only problem was the phones. I didn't have a cell phone (my N.A. one won't work in Europe), but I had a phone card. When I couldn't get an outside line, the desk informed me that their lines "weren't working". This continued for 3 days. I had to use a phone centre down the street, and when I complained that an unventilated phone booth wasn't very comfortable in 34C weather, the desk clerk told me I "shouldn't make phone calls in hot weather"!!

Reviews.Title: “thank you to the honest fellow at the front desk”
Reviews.Author: Bertony
Reviews.Content: First of all, the hotel was very comfortable for the two of us who were in Rome celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary. We stayed for four nights and found all of the amenities of the hotel to be quite pleasing. Of course, we were out touring most of the time, but it was still a comfortable place to rest up. The highlight of this hotel was that the front desk clerk (and I don't even know his name) was so very helpful with regard to my lost ring. On the morning of checkout, we headed out to our next destination. Later that afternoon I discovered that I didn't have my ring and realized that it must have fallen to the floor from the night table in the room. I phoned the hotel and the fellow who answered told me that the room had already been cleaned so it may not be found. He graciously agreed to double check the room for me and sure enough it was exactly where I thought it was. They held the ring for us until we arranged for pickup. Thanks again to the hotel staff! By the way, the great little restaurant across from the hotel was a real bonus to staying at the Windrose.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but Don't Book Through Hotel Clubs”
Reviews.Author: meinir
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel in November for a party 12 with HOTEL CLUBS and the money went out of my credit card and I received a booking conformation voucher. When we arrived at the hotel in March we were told that HOTEL CLUBS had not sent them the proper confirmation and payment so our rooms had not been kept. The hotel was very hepful and after a lot of phoning around they managed to get us all into a hotel about half an hour taxi ride away for the first night and the second night they had rooms for us at the Windrose. The hotel was excellent. Very clean and in an excellent location for the main station which takes all round Rome. Found the staff to be extremely helpful. Rooms may have been a bit on the small side but if you are in Rome you only use them to sleep in. They were clean and nicely decorated. I WOULD WARN ALL TRAVELLERS TO BE EXTREMELY CAEARFUL ABOUT BOOKING WITH HOTEL CLUBS A MONTH LATER THEY STILL HAVE NOT REFUNDED ME ANY MONEY AND AS I HAD TO PAY FOR THE BOTH HOTELS OUT THERE IT HAS LEFT ME SEREOUSLY OUT OF POCKET. YOU CAN NOT TALK TO ANYONE IN THE CUSTOMER SERVICE DEPARTMENT THEY ONLY ACCEPT EMAILS. PERHAPS IT WOULD BE A GOOD IDEA IF TRIP ADVISER STARTED A SITE ON TRAVEL FIRMS

Reviews.Title: “Birthday Treat”
Reviews.Author: maryspicer
Reviews.Content: Hotel Windrose - Rome 28th January 07 Senior Couple We have just returned from a 4 night stay at the Windrose. It was easy to find, within a 10 min walk from the Termini down a quiet street off the main road. The receptionist spoke good English. The room was rather small but very clean. The bed was especially comfortable. The breakfast was standard but a nice little breakfast room. Everywhere was so clean. We would certainly recommend this hotel. Opposite the hotel is a very nice restaurant which served a very varied menu of excellent quality and value. It was very popular with the Italians and tourists and had a very nice atmosphere

Reviews.Title: “Good one!”
Reviews.Author: abbie1705
Reviews.Content: A nice and comfortable place to come home to after a day of hard touring in Rome. The room was nicely decorated and furnished, nothing too fancy. Seemed newly renovated. Spacious by Euro hotel standards. Good location, only a short walk to Termini Station. The only downside was that our shower was tiny. Also, the continental breakfast is nothing to look forward to. Weak coffee, in a country where un caffe is king.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: TishSligo1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the windrose for 4 nights on a 3+1free deal. Close to Termini, but do your research before you get there, as its on a side street. Greeted in reception by friendly staff on arrival. English widely spoken, but encourage italian too. Room average size, clean, however a slight smokey smell.Bathroom very suffiicent, with a brilliant shower. Breakfast room small, with tables very close together, serving typically continental style breakfast. Itineraries suggested for touring the city from reception too. Excellent little family run restaurant across the road, we ate there 2 of the 4 nights. Always busy, food hot and served promptly. One thing i didnt like was the location of the Windrose.. definately not typical of the views given in the guide book. Via Gaeta is pretty dull after 6pm, with the windrose probably the best lit building there. Overall though, we enjoyed our stay. We were away sightseeing from early morning til late, so really it was a place to sleep. A good place for the first timer to Rome, close to bus and trains. Would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: NSWgirl
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend The Windrose Hotel in Rome. Lovely 3 star hotel. Staff were very welcoming and very helpful. Had all our tours organised through the front desk as well as our hire car. Could not have been more helpful. The hotel itself was very modern and clean with lovely rooms and even better bathrooms. Everything you need they have. The breakfast room was lovely and the breakfast itself was excellent. Would definitely stay there again and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: suejoanne
Reviews.Content: Close to termini, friendly staff, English widely spoken, clean. Excellent value for money

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Faughery
Reviews.Content: Hi, We spent a week at the Windrose in March 2006. Really nice hotel with friendly staff who had excellent english. Room not huge but adequate. Bathroom very modern and clean. Really convenient to termini which meant we were able to take the Leonardo Express train from the Airport and then only a five minute walk to the Hotel. Fantastic restaurant across the road which was great. We ate there every evening but one. Great place to eat when you have spent the day on your feet sightseeing. Food and wine wonderful. Would recommend this to hotel and plan to return again in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Recommend the Windrose Due to Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: vfayes
Reviews.Content: My husband (43) and I (41) stayed at this hotel Nov. 24-27, 2005, and were booked to stay again (upon returning from Florence) on Dec. 3-4. Upon checking in, we were surprised how tiny our room and bathroom were, but we expected small rooms in Rome and liked our little balcony and the charming view. In addition, everything had recently been renovated and looked fairly new. We also liked the proximity of the hotel to the train station, which, as big public transportation users, proved extremely convenient. Finally, there is a popular restaurant-La Famiglia--just across the street. (We met a couple from Arizona who flies to Italy several times a year just to eat at this restaurant! They even had New Year's reservations booked. We didn't find the food that good, but the busy atmosphere and family-style seating was nice.) The problem we had--and it's a big one--is the lack of effective responsiveness from the staff. We didn't get to bed during our first night there until 2:30 am. At 5:30 am, we were jolted from a deep sleep by loud pounding--"BOOM! BOOM! BOOM! BOOM!" and the shout, "HOUSEKEEPING!" This repeated several times--"BOOM! BOOM! BOOM! BOOM! HOUSEKEEPING!" At first, I thought the hotel was on fire and the staff was trying to wake us up and get us out. But my husband didn't think the person shouting was pounding on our door. We got up and looked out into the hall, to find two young, college age Amercian girls pounding on the door next store and shouting. When I informed them they had just woken us up from a dead sleep, the one doing the shouting explained they were "sorry," but their friend "Pete" wouldn't let them in to get their "stuff." Apparently, they were trying to trick him into opening the door by posing as Italian hotel staff who just happen to sound exactly like young American girls. Anyway, they were completely unconcerned with our sleep deprivation problem and kept pounding. Unable to figure out how to call the reception desk, my husband got dressed and went down to the night concierge to complain. The night concierge was argumentative, and kept pointing at the monitor to show that no one was visible in the hall, so what could he do? Video cameras are stationed in the hall of each floor of the hotel, but not every room is visible to each camera. Either the loud girls were out of the camera's range, or by the time the night concierge looked at the screen, "Pete" had let them in. My husband finally gave up and came back to the room. We finally got to sleep again, when, at 7:30 am, the kids next store resumed their shouting and pounding. I swung open the door to see the same girls standing outside the room, again trying to get "Pete" to let them in. I expressed amazement they had woken us up a second time, but they were utterly unfazed. My husband again went down to the reception desk and this time talked to the day concierge, who inexplicably made excuses for the girls ("perhaps they were just trying to find their friends"). Taking matters into my own hands, I called the kids' room, explained to "Pete" that they had twice woken us up, and asked him to please keep it quiet. He grunted some one syllable sound in response. I then went down to speak to the day concierge myself. He kept reiterating that he had already spoken to my husband, and he could perhaps talk to the kids, but basically, there was nothing he could do. When, responding to my inquiry, he told me the loud kids were booked to be there the same days we were, I asked him if we could change rooms. He agreed, but said I'd need to wait until noon. So, we changed our sightseeing schedule so we could be back at the hotel just a few hours later, and schlepped all our stuff from our third floor room to our new fifth floor room. The fifth floor room was, amazingly, EVEN SMALLER than our previous room; the shower was so tiny we had to turn sideways to get in and even then both the front and back of our bodies scraped the sides of the door; and worse--there was no balcony. While the remainder of our stay was quiet, it was due solely to the luck of having polite and respectful fellow guests on the fifth floor. We were extremely annoyed that the hotel staff failed to take any action whatsoever to ensure we could happily stay in our original room. They expressed no remorse at all, they offered no suggestions or solutions. Rather, they made excuses for the loud kids and clearly just wanted us to shut up and leave them alone. When we returned from Florence on Dec. 2, we arrived again at the Windrose to drop off our luggage. We knew it was too early to check in, but the hotel advertised that people who arrived early could drop off their luggage. My husband approached the reception desk and showed the day concierge our reservation voucher to let him know we had reservations. Seemingly indignant, the day concierge huffed that we couldn't check in until noon. My husband explained that we weren't there to check in, just to drop off our luggage. "But of course!" again huffed the seemingly yet inexplicably annoyed day concierge, as if he knew that's why we were there and how could we possibly be so stupid? He had us leave the luggage in the unlocked breakfast area, which made us nervous. After this absurd, 2 minute interaction with this man, who was so rude and condescending over something that shouldn't have been an issue, I couldn't respect myself for giving the Windrose any more of my hard-earned money. So my husband and I went off in search of another hotel. We booked a room at a different, nearby hotel, picked up our luggage, and left. However, afraid the Windrose might charge us anyway, before picking up our luggage we called our credit card company and alerted them that we didn't authorize any further charges from the Windrose. However, the Windrose did charge us for these two nights we didn't stay there, so I am now in the process of disputing the charges.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Smallest room on the planet, and dirty on top of it. There were black hairs in the bed!!! The bathroom was fairly ok but real small. Staff is ok. Breakfast is a joke. How did they get the 3*? We also stayed in one of Rome's 5* hotels and that bathroom was bigger than this entire room. What a difference!!. So a 1* hotel is probably sleeping outside the train station with all the homeless people who are urinating everywhere. Termini station - Latrini station..... Do not stay around here, there are much nicer places in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend the Windrose at Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was at the Windrose for 3 nights, with my boyfriend and another couple. We liked it a lot, the rooms were comfortable and clean, the breakfast was good enough, the common areas very, very nice and the people very helpfull. It's close to the Termini Station, a central point in Rome, were you can get the bus, metro, train and taxis, and it's very easy to get to some of the important views of Rome: the Collosseo, Roman Forum, Piazza Venezia,... We used only once the metro, to get to the Vatican City, all the rest we walked and walked, and despite the heat, it's ok to walk in Rome! We reccomend this 3* hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Liked the hotel but not the location.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Windrose is within walking distance to the Termini which was appreciated since we arrived in Rome by train. It is near a metro stop, some interesting churches and the Baths of Diocletian but not close to the popular old center of Rome. We spent more time than we wanted getting to and from the hotel. But the room was acceptable, especially the bathroom, and quiet. The desk staff was helpful and polite. The breakfast room is small but we never had a problem getting a table. We learned if you do not ask for coffee or tea you do not get a morning croissant! La Familia restaurant across the street was great and always crowded but we loved it. Check out the wine bar and grocery store near by but have exact change!

Reviews.Title: “Great base”
Reviews.Author: RDouglas
Reviews.Content: My husband (65) and I (63) really enjoyed our three nights at the Windrose in June 2005. The location was great. A five minute walk from the buses and trains at Termini Station with a bank with an off-street ATM on the way, supermarket along the street and a convenience store around the corner. We loved our 2 dinners and 1 lunch at La Famiglia Pizzeria opposite the hotel. Via Gaeta is a narrow one-way street with very little traffic and although our room overlooked the street the double-glazed windows were totally effective.The air-conditioner was efficient and quiet and the bar fridge was silent. Our room had all we needed including a wardrobe with a personal safe. The bathroom was modern and adequate although a slightly larger shower cubicle would be an improvement. The breakfast room was pleasant, the food good enough and the cappuccino excellent. We appreciated the modern lift and the helpfulness of the reception staff who spoke English. For tourists on a budget who are out all day and just want a convenient, clean and comfortable place to shower and sleep the Windrose is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “this is a 2 stars quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: SALTITAO
Reviews.Content: we are a coulple of 40's and we have stayed at room 602 Breakfast very poor and the room is very small. No views. It doesn't seem to me very safe to walk here at night and there are nothing to see , no shops , no restaurants , nothing nice. Bed was terrible:you know when you fall in the middle ... TV didn't work propperly to foreign channels nor raiuno.they said the tecnic would come to fix the antena but it's not true. I wouldn't recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Please Read This!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family did not have the pleasure of staying at this hotel. We however, were charged. We were booked at this hotel on April 7, 2005. Unfortunately, it was during the death and funeral of Pope John Paul and our flight was cancelled. This lovely hotel was kind enough to still charge us even though I am sure they were able to rent our room out!!! If it was under any other circumstance I would have no problem with being charged for not showing but....Please don't support a hotel that has no compassion during a tragic time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Freddie64
Reviews.Content: Our trip to Rome on March 28th to 31st 2005. Because we were 7 persons, we booked a single, a double and a quadruple room. All the rooms were clean, large enough for us and had comfortable beds. Also the lovely bathrooms had a good size. The roomes which faced onto the back of the hotel were very quite. The staff was very helpful and offered us a pick-up service from the airport. The hotel is only a short walk away from Termini station, so you can get everywere in Rome by bus or metro. If we come back to Rome, we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend the Windrose Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: rr108
Reviews.Content: The Windrose Hotel was a standard 3 star hotel. It is walking distance from Termini but on a quieter side street. A big supermarket is about 2 blocks away for snacks. Everything was clean and pleasantly furnished. The pastries/coffee at breakfast were good. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “No disappointments at The Windrose”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from our first trip to Rome and would like to add our endorsement of the Windrose Hotel on Via Gaeta to those already posted. We booked it on the recommendation of my sister, and found the somewhat negative review of Feb.2004 was definitely not our positive experience. This bright clean compact hotel is a leisurely 10 min. stroll from the Termini, reception staff (2 men and 1 lady) were always pleasant and helpful, breakfast room was warm and cosy and the buffet of juices, cerals and rolls was all we wanted to get us started each morning. We could also order bacon and eggs for a small supplement if needed. The 4 ladies who served the tea, coffee and croissants were prompt and attentive and the intimate surroundings allowed us to converse with fellow diners from Australia, USA, England and Ireland. Our 6th floor room faced onto the back of the hotel, was large enough for the two of us with nice comfortable bed, tiled floor bathroom with bath and shower, minibar/fridge and TV and maid service daily. We had our own travel kettle so we could make tea/coffee as needed. There's a busy little restaurant just opposite, a large supermarket further down the street, the 492 bus stops on Via Volturno and the 40 express bus from Termini, so in our opinion, the location is excellent for returning during the day with shopping or just for a rest from sightseeing. We were aprehensive about the Termini area, having read so many different reviews, but The Windrose is far enough away not to be worried. We will certainly stay here again on our next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “What problems? A Small, clean, lovely Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: samisnail
Reviews.Content: Our stay 29/11/04 - 02/12/04. Don't waste time haggling for a taxi from the Airport, take the Terrorvision bus service, tickets available from desk inside the Arrivals Terminal. Hotel is a short walk from drop off point at Termini Station. We took a taxi, but there really is no need (we paid 20euros for what was only a 5 min walk). Yes there are homeless people and beggars at the station but not on the Via Gaeta where hotel is situated (safe, quiet street). Hotel is small, very clean and well maintained (as previous feedbacks state). Staff helpful with local information (Metro strike etc). We found it cheaper to get drinks and snacks from the supermarket situated on Via Gaeta rather than at tourist spots (on exiting hotel, turn left, follow road and find supermarket on the corner to your right). This was our first big city break and trip to Rome, it felt very reassuring to go back to the Windrose to relax after long day of sight seeing. I will use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Tourist Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: historyhnyb
Reviews.Content: Like another reviewer said, do not expect a 5-star hotel. This is a standard tourist class hotel earning all of the 3-stars that it is rated. I stayed in a triple and the rooms were quite comfortable. The breakfast was just enough in the morning to get something in your stomach for a day of sight seeing and walking. The convenience to Termini station could not be beat. One of the highlights of staying at this hotel is the restaurant across the street. Not only is it convenient and reasonably price the food is outstanding. The only complaint I had would be the noise level. Our room was facing the street and it got rather noisy. I would request and interior room or one higher up. I would definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended- great beds, clean, friendly, good location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Don't expect a 5 star hotel, but this was a very nice place to stay! Clean, very nicely decorated, good location, and the beds were well above average for a good nights sleep. We stayed there just last week (11-2 to 11-9-2004) and it was very nice. Good elevator, friendly front desk service, maid did a great job keeping the room tidy, fresh towels and nothing of our was disturbed. The breakfasts were simple with two choiced dry cereal, milk, rolls, sweet rolls, juices (3), coffee, tea, meat and cheese. and the usual jellies. Lovely little breakfast room too. Bath rooms were lovely, rooms were smallish, but very comfortable. TV didn't get CNN for news fans. Our room faced the front street and the little restaurant across the street had several musicians that would serinade us each evening and we did keep the window open a little even in Nov to hear the music! The restaurant across the street had very good food (particularly the soup!) but you have to watch them cause they rip you off if you don't watch closely. Great double glazed windows on the hotel too! If you closed them you heard very little noice and it's off of a main drag so you don't get the extra traffic. Even with some city noice that you will find in Rome, it was very nice. You can walk nearly anywhere you want to go, but keep in mind you are not in the main city center so you will have to walk. Close to some great shopping too! We have traveled a great deal and found this to be a good choice for the price and recommend it to anyone staying in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Endorsement for Windrose Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stand by my endorsement of the Windrose Hotel. I stayed there with my daughter in March, 2004 and found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. The hotel is spotless, nice, up-dated bathrooms, and in general, very pleasing. It is true that it is not in the nicest area but also not the worst. I love the proximity to all transportation. It's true some things are far; however, you can't be near everything and the bus and subway transportation is so cheap, I do not feel that is a problem.

HotelInfo.Name: Windrose Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via Gaeta 39, 00185 Rome, Italy
